taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Classical Latin name, from Greek figos, an oak with edible acorns, probably from Greek fagein, to eat]

references.reference: Cooper, A. W. and E. P. Mercer. 1977. Morphological variation in Fagus grandifolia Ehrh. in North Carolina. J. Elisha Mitchell Sci. Soc. 93: 136-149.
Hardin, J. W. and G. P. Johnson. 1985. Atlas of foliar surface features in woody plants, VIII. Fagus and Castanea (Fagaceae) of eastern North America. Bull. Torrey Bot. Club 112: 11-20.
Rehder, A. J. 1907. Some new or little known forms of New England trees. Rhodora 9: 109-116.
